title: Foundation: Basic Skills and Apprenticeship
description: Formal education is not a strict requirement, but a good grasp of basic mathematics for measurements is essential. The traditional and most effective way to start is by working as an apprentice under an experienced carpenter.
skills: Basic hand tool usage (saw, chisel, plane)

title: Vocational Training (NVQ Level 3 & 4)
description: To professionalize your skills, enroll in a Carpentry or Wood Technology course at a vocational training center. This provides structured training on joinery, furniture making, and the use of power tools, leading to an NVQ certification.

title: Skilled Carpenter
description: Work as a skilled carpenter for a furniture manufacturer, a construction company, or an interior design firm. You will be responsible for creating furniture, installing doors and windows, building roof structures, or crafting custom woodwork.

title: Master Carpenter / Furniture Designer
description: Become a master craftsman, known for high-quality, specialized work. You could specialize in areas like antique furniture restoration, custom kitchen cabinetry, or architectural woodwork. Some may also move into furniture design, creating their own unique pieces.
qualifications: A strong portfolio of high-quality work

title: Workshop Owner / Contractor
description: With extensive experience and a good reputation, you can start your own carpentry workshop or business. This involves managing projects, hiring other carpenters, dealing with clients, and handling the financial side of the business.
